document.bingtitle: Evangeline Lucca tasered by stun gun in McDonald's drive-thru ...
document.webtitle: Evangeline Lucca tasered by stun gun in McDonald's drive-thru after cutting line | Mail Online
document.description: Authorities in Hope Mills, North Carolina, say Lucca bypassed the order screen and the line at the fast food restaurant, instead pulling directly up to the pick-up ...
document.body:
Home News U.S. Sport TV&Showbiz; Femail Health Science Money RightMinds Coffee Break Travel Columnists
News Home Arts Headlines Pictures Most read News Board
My Profile Logout Login Find a Job M&S;Wine Our Papers Feedback Thursday, Jul 12 2012 3PM 17°C 6PM 15°C 5-Day Forecast She's not loving it: Woman tasered in McDonald's drive-thru after cutting line
By Daily Mail Reporter UPDATED: 13:41 GMT, 5 February 2012
Comments ( 55 ) Share
Police used a Stun Gun on a woman who had been blocking a McDonald’s drive-thru for more than 20 minutes.
Evangeline Lucca, 37, had cut the line and refused to leave before she was served.
Employees, meanwhile, refused to attend to Lucca because she cut the queue.
Have it your way: Evangeline Lucca, 37, was Tasered by police after she refused to move from a McDonald's queue
Authorities in Hope Mills, North Carolina, say Lucca bypassed the order screen and the line at the fast food restaurant, instead pulling directly up to the pick-up window Friday afternoon.
Sheriff’s Office spokeswoman Debbie Tanna told the Fay Observer:‘They told her she had to go around and wait like everybody else did and place her order that way, they weren’t set up at the that window to taker her order.’
More...
Dancing boy, 9, told to 'Beat It' for imitating notorious Michael Jackson 'crotch grab' move during school fundraiser 'The vice president of the U.S. is... Bill Clinton!' Shocking video shows high school students are woefully uninformed
But Ms Tanna added:‘She wasn’t having any of that.’
The woman still refused to move, and police were called after that.
Employees told the paper that Lucca often tried to jump the line, but that they finally got sick of it.
Get it to go: Police used a Stun Gun on Lucca after she made threats to the deputies
When the deputies arrived, they said she was‘defiant’to them and was threatening them.
Authorities said Lucca was shocked after she blocked the line for 20 minutes. Deputies then performed a‘drive stun’on her, meaning the device was applied directly to her skin, rather than firing the Taser cartridge.
Her three-year-old daughter was with her and was taken into protective custody.
Lucca was charged with second-degree trespassing.

Comments ( 55 )
Here's what other readers have said. Why not debate this issue live on our message boards.
The comments below have not been moderated.
Newest Oldest Best rated Worst rated View all If I would've been the manager of that McD I would've done the same thing. Calling the cops&have them escort her away was the right thing to do. The fact the cops had to taze her was because she refused to obey a police officer. If tazing wouldn't have worked, physically pulling her from the car would follow. Her child should be taken from her and put into a foster home, her mom put her in harms way by refusing to obey the cops. Why reward bad behavior? Don, If I was to walk in your front door&grab the keys to your car&said I'm taking your car because I want it, would you let me? Thats exactly what Lucca tried to do .As a culinary art student you have a lot to learn about the real world. It's one thing to make me a new steak if I claim it was over cooked. It's something completely different to serve someone who just barges into your resturant, bypasses the 1 hr wait in the lobby and sits down demanding service right now is wrong. I'd call the cops and have them removed
- Shawn Schafer, Burlington, ND USA, 07/2/2012 03:17 Click to rate Rating 38 Report abuse
Hey Don, you should change careers..Your comments make you sound just like this loser who thinks she is better than everyone else. You missed the point big time.. She is owed nothing..
- Nirad, Tacoma, USA, 06/2/2012 23:56 Click to rate Rating 33 Report abuse
Obviously not the happy meal. - jim martin, goldendale usa, 5/2/2012 11:16>>>>>>>>>nah, she had the zappy meal (sorry...)
- David, Windsor, 06/2/2012 22:00 Click to rate Rating 27 Report abuse
Wow, who in there right mind acts the way this lady acted? She got what she deserved. Who the hell does she think she is? I'm suprised some of the people that got cut on didn't do anything to her. At the very least I would have yelled at that B&^%h. Good job local law enforement. bravo!!! Taser again for all I care.
- Mike, Silver Spring USA, 06/2/2012 21:54 Click to rate Rating 35 Report abuse
Anyone who excuses this woman's behavior has no sense of right and wrong. They would sooner defend the feral human population's rotten behavior than consider the benefits of a civilized society to all. And yes, tasering feral humans who are a threat to life and limb is the civilized thing to do. Please, spare us the feigned civility and sophistication.
- Ken, Virginia, 06/2/2012 16:54 Click to rate Rating 87 Report abuse
I believe that"queuing"is a British invention from a time that"stealing someone else's time"was considered very bad form. Hence"queuing"is only considered the norm in the UK, US, Australia Canada etc. Try waiting-in-turn in Europe (or London nowadays for that matter!) and you'll be waiting a very long time. Shame really because good manors costs nothing.
- fed-up-citizen, uk, 06/2/2012 15:58 Click to rate Rating 30 Report abuse
People like Don Leblanc are what's wrong with this country...how can you defend her like that? She was way in the wrong and she got puished, it's simple. Stop making excuses for people to break rules
- Ben, Abilene, USA, 06/2/2012 15:28 Click to rate Rating 78 Report abuse
Now, if only the police will start tazing people who bring 30 items to the 10 items or less lane, we can finally start having justice in America.
- Lizard, New Albany, USA, 06/2/2012 14:26 Click to rate Rating 85 Report abuse
Why not tazer the customers, the burgers taste like they have been tazered anyway!
- Philip Harrison, Former Royal Marine and ex pat Brittany France, 06/2/2012 12:43 Click to rate Rating 46 Report abuse
Sounds like she got her just McDeserts.
- George, Rockville USA, 06/2/2012 11:35 Click to rate Rating 80 Report abuse
